clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial Investigating Safety and Efficacy of Treatment With BAY94-9027 in Severe Hemophilia A
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II/III, Multicenter, Partially Randomized, Open Label Trial Investigating Safety and Efficacy of On-demand and Prophylactic Treatment With BAY94-9027 in Severe Hemophilia A

brief_summary.textblock:
Haemophilia A is an inherited disorder in which one of the proteins, Factor VIII, needed to form blood clots is missing or not present in sufficient levels. In a person with haemophilia A, the clotting process is slowed and the person experiences bleeds that can result in serious problems and potential disability.
The current standard treatment for severe haemophilia A is regularly scheduled infusion of FVIII to keep levels high enough to prevent bleeding. Due to the short half-life of FVIII, prophylaxis may require treatment as often as every other day.
In this trial safety and efficacy of a long-acting recombinant factor VIII molecule is evaluated in subjects with severe Hemophilia A.
120-140 patients will receive open label treatment with long-acting rFVIII either on-demand to treat bleeds or prophylactically for 36 weeks in the main trial plus an optional extension to continue treatment for at least 100 total exposure days (ED). Patients on prophylactic treatment will receive study drug at dosing intervals between once and twice a week depending on their observed bleeding. Patients will attend the treatment centre for routine blood samples and be required to keep an electronic diary.
Male patients aged 12-65, with severe hemophilia A, previously treated with FVIII for at least 50 exposure days may be eligible for this study.

detailed_description.textblock:
Subjects in prophylactic treatment arms will undergo clinical evaluation at 10 weeks. Those with adequate control of bleeding will undergo randomization to every 5 or 7 day infusion. Those with continued bleeding will remain in treatment arm and have an increase in dose.
Part B-major surgery - optional sub study included to collect information on efficacy of BAY94-9027 in major surgical setting. Due to rarity of surgery in this population, enrollment to this sub-study may be independent of participation in main study.

primary_outcome.measure: Annualized Number of Total Bleeds in On-demand Treatment Arm (Weeks 0 -36) and in Each Prophylaxis Arm (Weeks 10 - 36, Excluding Rescue Bleeds) - Part A, Main Trial
primary_outcome.time_frame: On-demand: Weeks 0 -36 and Prophylaxis: Weeks 10 - 36 during Part A
primary_outcome.description: Annualized number of total bleeds was defined as the annualized sum of spontaneous bleeds and trauma bleeds. A participant who had the one-time increase in dose frequency was regarded as rescued. A rescue bleed was a bleed that occured after the dose frequency was increased. Rescue bleeds and periods were not considered for the annualized bleeding rate (ABR).

secondary_outcome.measure: Annualized Number of Joint Bleeds, Trauma, Spontaneous Bleeds in On-demand Treatment Arm (Weeks 0 -36) and in Each Prophylaxis Arm (Weeks 10 - 36, Excluding Rescue Bleeds) - Part A
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On-demand: Weeks 0 -36 and Prophylaxis: Weeks 10 - 36 during Part A
secondary_outcome.description: A participant who had the one-time increase in dose frequency was regarded as rescued. A rescue bleed was a bleed that occured after the dose frequency was increased. Rescue bleeds and periods were not considered for the ABR.

secondary_outcome.measure: Annualized Number of Total Bleeds in On-demand Treatment Arm and in Each Prophylaxis Arm, Part A, Extension
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at least 100 total exposure days acquired, Median (range) time in extension: 464 days (45-700)
secondary_outcome.description: Annualized number of total bleeds was defined as the annualized sum of spontaneous bleeds and trauma bleeds.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Developed Human Coagulation Factor VIII (FVIII) Inhibitor - Part A
secondary_outcome.description: FVIII inhibitor testing was done according to the Nijmegen modified Bethesda assay. A positive inhibitor test was defined with a threshold of ≥0.6 Bethesda unit (BU) at the central laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Bleeds Requiring 1, 2 or >= 3 Infusions to Control the Bleed - Part A
secondary_outcome.description: Number of bleeds requiring 1, 2 or >= 3 infusions to control the bleeding

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Bleeds According to Locations - Part A
secondary_outcome.description: Bleed locations were categorised as joint, muscle, skin/mucosa, internal, others and missing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Bleeds Over Time Since Previous Prophylaxis Infusion - Part A
Number of Bleeds According to Participant's Assessment of Response to Treatment - Part A
secondary_outcome.description: Response to treatment was assessed by participant as excellent, good, moderate, poor or missing during Part A of the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Recombinant Human Factor VIII (rFVIII) Usage Expressed as Total Dose Per Kilogram Per Year - Part A
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On-demand: Weeks 0 -36 and Prophylaxis: Weeks 10 - 36 during Part A
secondary_outcome.description: For prophylaxis patients, the dose is related to all infusions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Recombinant Human Factor VIII (rFVIII) Usage Expressed as Dose Per Kilogram Per Infusion - Part A
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On-demand: Weeks 0 -36 and Prophylaxis: Weeks 10 - 36 during Part A
secondary_outcome.description: For prophylaxis patients, the dose per infusion related to prophylaxis infusion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Requiring an Increase in Dose Frequency, or Dose Increase, During Weeks 10 to 36 - Part A
Number of Surgeries According to Physician's Assessment of Adequacy of Hemostasis in Major Surgery - Part B
secondary_outcome.description: Major surgery was defined as any surgical or invasive procedure (elective or emergent) in which the overall bleeding risk was excessive, required a general anesthetic in an individual without a bleeding disorder, penetrated or exposed a major body cavity, resulted in substantial impairment of physical or physiological functions, or required special anatomic knowledge or manipulative skill. Adequacy of hemostasis was assessed as excellent, good, moderate or poor, by the surgeon or interventionalist during Part B of the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Recombinant Human Factor VIII (rFVIII) Usage Expressed as Dose Per Kilogram Per Infusion for Major Surgery - Part B
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 weeks post-surgery during Part B
secondary_outcome.description: Major surgery was defined as any surgical or invasive procedure (elective or emergent) in which the overall bleeding risk was excessive, required a general anesthetic in an individual without a bleeding disorder, penetrated or exposed a major body cavity, resulted in substantial impairment of physical or physiological functions, or required special anatomic knowledge or manipulative skill. Total dose per kilogram per Infusion was expressed in international units per kilogram per infusion (IU/kg/infusion).

secondary_outcome.measure: Recombinant Human Factor VIII (rFVIII) Usage Expressed as Number of Infusions for Major Surgery - Part B
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 weeks post-surgery during Part B
secondary_outcome.description: Major surgery was defined as any surgical or invasive procedure (elective or emergent) in which the overall bleeding risk was excessive, required a general anesthetic in an individual without a bleeding disorder, penetrated or exposed a major body cavity, resulted in substantial impairment of physical or physiological functions, or required special anatomic knowledge or manipulative skill.rFVIII usage expressed as number of infusions and IU/kg per year, as well as IU/kg per event (surgery) was assessed by investigator.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Drug Plasma Concentration (Cmax) Following Single and Multiple Doses of BAY94-9027, Chromogenic Assay - Part A
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 0 and 36: pre-infusion (0 hours), post-infusion 15, 30 minutes, 1, 3, 6, 8, 24, 48, 72, 96 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax: Maximum observed drug concentration following an infusion of 60 IU/kg

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Versus Time Curve From Zero to Infinity (AUC) Following Single and Multiple Doses of BAY94-9027, Chromogenic Assay - Part A
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 0 and 36: pre-infusion (0 hours), post-infusion 15, 30 minutes, 1, 3, 6, 8, 24, 48, 72, 96 hours
secondary_outcome.description: AUC: The total area under the plasma concentration versus time curve following an infusion of 60 IU/kg .

secondary_outcome.measure: Terminal Elimination Half Life (t1/2) Following Single and Multiple Doses of BAY94-9027, Chromogenic Assay - Part A
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 0 and 36: pre-infusion (0 hours), post-infusion 15, 30 minutes, 1, 3, 6, 8, 24, 48, 72, 96 hours
secondary_outcome.description: t1/2: Terminal half-life is the time the plasma concentration during terminal phase is halved following an infusion of 60 IU/kg .

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Human Coagulation Factor VIII (FVIII) Recovery Value by Chromogenic Assay - Part A
secondary_outcome.description: Recovery was calculated by the following formula: Recovery = (post-infusion FVIII activity - pre-infusion FVIII activity ) * weight / dose (in IU). Recovery is the increase of FVIII activity after the injection normalized by dose: IU/dl per IU/kg = kg/dL

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Quality of Life by Hemophilia Specific Quality of Life Instrument or Questionnaire for Adults (Haemo-QoL-A) Overall Score at Week 36 - Part A
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 0 (baseline) and Week 36 during Part A
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life (QoL) was measured by the Haemo-QoL-A overall score, which ranged from 0 (the worst condition) to 100 (the best condition).

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Overall Pain Severity and Interference Due to Pain at Week 36 - Part A
other_outcome.time_frame: Week 0 (baseline) and Week 36 during Part A
other_outcome.description: Brief Pain Inventory (BPI) - Short Form (BPI-SF) was a 15-item, self-administered, validated tool developed to assess pain used in the study for patient reported outcomes. Scores ranged from 0 to 10 and a higher score indicates a higher level of pain/interference.

other_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI) Questionnaire at Week 36 - Part A
other_outcome.time_frame: Week 0 (baseline) and Week 36 during Part A
other_outcome.description: The WPAI is a validated instrument to assess the effect of hemophilia on ability to work, attend classes, and perform regular daily activities in participants aged 12 and above. The WPAI also contained classroom impairment questions (CIQ). The questionnaire was self-administered and comprised of nine questions that elicited information on work, classroom, and daily activity impairment during the previous seven days. WPAI outcomes that are overall work and activity impairment, transformed to impairment percentages (range from 0 to 100), with higher numbers indicating greater impairment and less productivity.

other_outcome.measure: Recombinant Human Factor VIII (rFVIII) Usage Expressed as Number of Infusions- Part A
other_outcome.time_frame: On-demand: Weeks 0 -36 and Prophylaxis: Weeks 10 - 36 during Part A
other_outcome.description: For prophylaxis patients, the dose is related to all infusions.

other_outcome.measure: Recombinant Human Factor VIII (rFVIII) Usage Expressed as Dose Per Kilogram With Prophylaxis Treatment - Part A
other_outcome.description: For prophylaxis patients, the dose per kilogram is related to prophylaxis infusions.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Minor Surgeries According to Physician's Assessment of Adequacy of Hemostasis - Part A
other_outcome.description: Minor surgery was defined as any surgical procedure that did not meet the definition of major, and included simple dental extractions, incision and drainage of abscesses, or simple excisions.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Surgeries According to Physician's Assessment of Response to Hemostasis, Post-surgery - Part B Main Trial
other_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 weeks post-surgery during Part B
other_outcome.description: Response to treatment during surgery was assessed by investigator/surgeon as excellent, good, moderate, poor or missing during Part B of the study.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Change/Drop in Hemoglobin/Hematocrit Laboratory Assessments - Part B
other_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 weeks post-surgery during Part B
other_outcome.description: Hematocrit is defined as the volume percentage (%) of red blood cells in blood.

other_outcome.measure: Maximum Blood Loss During Major Surgery - Part B
other_outcome.description: Major surgery was defined as any surgical or invasive procedure (elective or emergent) in which the overall bleeding risk was excessive, required a general anesthetic in an individual without a bleeding disorder, penetrated or exposed a major body cavity, resulted in substantial impairment of physical or physiological functions, or required special anatomic knowledge or manipulative skill.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Took Anti-fibrinolytic Medications During Major Surgery - Part B
other_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 weeks post-surgery during Part B
other_outcome.description: Major surgery was defined as any surgical or invasive procedure (elective or emergent) in which the overall bleeding risk was excessive, required a general anesthetic in an individual without a bleeding disorder, penetrated or exposed a major body cavity, resulted in substantial impairment of physical or physiological functions, or required special anatomic knowledge or manipulative skill.

other_outcome.measure: Volume of Blood Transfused in Major Surgery - Part B
other_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 weeks post-surgery during Part B
other_outcome.description: Major surgery was defined as any surgical or invasive procedure (elective or emergent) in which the overall bleeding risk was excessive, required a general anesthetic in an individual without a bleeding disorder, penetrated or exposed a major body cavity, resulted in substantial impairment of physical or physiological functions, or required special anatomic knowledge or manipulative skill.

arm_group.description: On-demand treatment of BAY94-9027 at individual dose and number of infusions based upon location and severity of bleeds

Prophylaxis treatment of BAY94-9027; 2 infusions per week over 10 weeks followed by 2 infusions per week over 26 weeks in the main trial; and at least 1 day per week in the extension for at least 100 ED

Prophylaxis treatment of BAY94-9027; 2 infusions per week over 10 weeks followed by infusion every 5 days over 26 weeks in the main trial; and at least 1 day per week in the extension for at least 100 ED

Prophylaxis treatment of BAY94-9027; 2 infusions per week over 10 weeks followed by infusion every 7 days over 26 weeks in the main trial; and at least 1 day per week in the extension for at least 100 ED

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male; 12-65 years of age
- Subjects with severe hemophilia A
- Previously treated with factor VIII for a minimum of 150 exposure days
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inhibitors to FVIII (current evidence or history)
- Any other inherited or acquired bleeding disorder in addition to Hemophilia A
- Platelet count < 100,000/mm3
- Creatinine > 2x upper limit of normal or AST/ALT (aspartate aminotransferase/alanine aminotransferase) > 5x upper limit of normal

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted in 3 parts: Part A (main study [36-week treatment period] and an optional extension [at least 100 total exposure days]) and Part B for major surgeries (up to 3 weeks).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of 149 participants screened in Part A, 134 were treated, reasons for non-inclusion were screen failure, consent withdrawal, and non-adherence to protocol visit windows. Participants selected either on-demand or prophylaxis treatment at start of study according to their preference. Randomization to prophylaxis arms occurred after week 10.

group.title: BAY94-9027 On-demand Treatment, Part A
group.description: Participants received on-demand treatment with BAY94-9027 as an intravenous (IV) infusion at a dose as indicated based upon location and severity of bleeds (a maximum of 60 international units per kilogram [IU/kg]). Participants entering extension either continued their on-demand treatment or switched to one of the prophylaxis regimens.

group.title: BAY94-9027 Prophylaxis Treatment, Part A
group.description: All participants started BAY94-9027 IV infusion, with 2x/week at a dose of 25 IU/kg for 10 weeks. Thereafter, participants with less than 2 spontaneous joint and/or muscle bleeds were randomized 1:1 to either every 5 or every 7 days dosing regimen. High bleeders continued 2x/week infusion (2x/week ‘failed’). Participants qualified to be randomized but enrolled after randomized arms were filled, remained on 2x/week treatment (2x/week ‘forced’ group). Participants entering extension either continued their prophylaxis regimen or switched to one of the other prophylaxis regimens.

group.title: BAY949027 Treatment in Major Surgery, Part B
group.description: Participants who underwent major surgery received study drug during their hospital stay up to 3 weeks post surgery. Participants were treated according to the type of procedure, using tailored doses (a maximum of 60 IU/kg/infusion) expected to maintain acceptable therapeutic level of FVIII activity.

group.title: BAY94-9027 On-demand Treatment, Main Trial
group.description: Participants received on-demand treatment with BAY94-9027 as an intravenous (IV)infusion at a dose as indicated based upon location and severity of bleeds (a maximum of 60 international units per kilogram [IU/kg]).

group.title: BAY94-9027 Prophylaxis Treatment, 2x/Week Dropped, Main Trial
group.description: 4 participants dropped out during week 0-10

group.title: BAY94-9027 Prophylaxis Treatment, 2x/Week Failed, Main Trial
group.description: All participants started BAY94-9027 IV infusion with 2x/week at a dose of 25 IU/kg for 10 weeks. High bleeders (with 2 or more muscle or joint bleeds in the first 10 weeks) continued 2x/week infusion (2x/week ‘failed’) at a dose of 30 to 40 IU/kg.

group.title: BAY94-9027 Prophylaxis Treatment, 2x/Week Forced, Main Trial
group.description: All participants started BAY94-9027 IV infusion with 2x/week at a dose of 25 IU/kg for 10 weeks. Participants with < 2 spontaneous joint and/or muscle bleeds were randomized 1:1 to either every 5 or every 7 days dosing regimen. Participants enrolled after randomization arms were filled continued 2x/week treatment at a dose of 30-40 IU/kg (2x/week ‘forced’).

group.title: BAY94-9027 Prophylaxis Treatment, Every 5 Days, Main Trial
group.description: All participants started BAY94-9027 IV infusion with 2x/week at a dose of 25 IU/kg for 10 weeks. Participants with < 2 spontaneous joint and/or muscle bleeds were randomized 1:1 to either every 5 or every 7 days dosing regimen, participants randomized to the every 5 days treatment arm were to begin treatment with 45 IU/kg every 5 days with the option to increase dose up to 60 IU/kg/infusion.

group.title: BAY94-9027 Prophylaxis Treatment, Every 7 Days, Main Trial
group.description: All participants started BAY94-9027 IV infusion with 2x/week at a dose of 25 IU/kg for 10 weeks. Participants <2 spontaneous joint and/or muscle bleeds were randomized 1:1 to either every 5 or every 7 days dosing regimen, participants randomized to the every 7 days treatment arm were to administer a dose of 60 IU/kg (maximum 6000 IU) every 7 days.

group.title: BAY94-9027 Treatment in Major Surgery, Part B Only
group.description: Participants treated in Part B only were included. Participants treated in Part A and continued in Part B were excluded. Participants who underwent major surgery received study drug during their hospital stay and up until hospital discharge or 3 weeks post-surgery, whichever came first. Participants were treated according to the type of procedure, using tailored doses (a maximum of 60 IU/kg) expected to maintain acceptable therapeutic level of FVIII activity.

group.title: BAY94-9027 Prophylaxis Treatment, Week 0-36, Main Trial
group.description: All participants in the prophylaxis arms started BAY94-9027 IV infusion, with 2x/week at a dose of 25 IU/kg for 10 weeks. Thereafter, participants with less than 2 spontaneous joint and/or muscle bleeds were randomized 1:1 to either every 5 or every 7 days dosing regimen. High bleeders continued 2x/week infusion (2x/week ‘failed’). Participants qualified to be randomized, but enrolled after randomized arms were filled, remained on 2x/week treatment (2x/week ‘forced’ group).

measure.population: Part A ITT population, analysis population includes participants who presented >=1 bleeding event.

group.title: BAY94-9027 On-demand Treatment, Main Trial
group.description: Participants received on-demand treatment with BAY94-9027 as an intravenous (IV)infusion at a dose as indicated based upon location and severity of bleeds (a maximum of 60 international units per kilogram [IU/kg]).

group.title: BAY94-9027 Prophylaxis Treatment, 2x/Week Failed, Main Trial
group.description: All participants started BAY94-9027 IV infusion with 2x/week at a dose of 25 IU/kg for 10 weeks. High bleeders (with 2 or more muscle or joint bleeds in the first 10 weeks) continued 2x/week infusion (2x/week ‘failed’) at a dose of 30 to 40 IU/kg.

group.title: BAY94-9027 Prophylaxis Treatment, 2x/Week Forced, Main Trial
group.description: All participants started BAY94-9027 IV infusion with 2x/week at a dose of 25 IU/kg for 10 weeks. Participants with < 2 spontaneous joint and/or muscle bleeds were randomized 1:1 to either every 5 or every 7 days dosing regimen. Participants enrolled after randomization arms were filled continued 2x/week treatment at a dose of 30-40 IU/kg (2x/week ‘forced’).

group.title: BAY94-9027 Prophylaxis Treatment, Every 5 Days, Main Trial
group.description: All participants started BAY94-9027 IV infusion with 2x/week at a dose of 25 IU/kg for 10 weeks. Participants with < 2 spontaneous joint and/or muscle bleeds were randomized 1:1 to either every 5 or every 7 days dosing regimen, participants randomized to the every 5 days treatment arm were to begin treatment with 45 IU/kg every 5 days with the option to increase dose up to 60 IU/kg/infusion.

group.title: BAY94-9027 Prophylaxis Treatment, Every 7 Days, Main Trial
group.description: All participants started BAY94-9027 IV infusion with 2x/week at a dose of 25 IU/kg for 10 weeks. Participants <2 spontaneous joint and/or muscle bleeds were randomized 1:1 to either every 5 or every 7 days dosing regimen, participants randomized to the every 7 days treatment arm were to administer a dose of 60 IU/kg (maximum 6000 IU) every 7 days.

group.title: BAY94-9027 Prophylaxis Treatment Total, Main Trial
group.description: All participants receiving an schedule of prophylaxis treatment, all prophylaxis arms combined.

measure.title: Recombinant Human Factor VIII (rFVIII) Usage Expressed as Total Dose Per Kilogram Per Year - Part A
measure.description: For prophylaxis patients, the dose is related to all infusions.
measure.population: ITT population part A week 10-36, 4 participants dropped out during week 0-10.

outcome.title: Number of Surgeries According to Physician's Assessment of Adequacy of Hemostasis in Major Surgery - Part B
outcome.description: Major surgery was defined as any surgical or invasive procedure (elective or emergent) in which the overall bleeding risk was excessive, required a general anesthetic in an individual without a bleeding disorder, penetrated or exposed a major body cavity, resulted in substantial impairment of physical or physiological functions, or required special anatomic knowledge or manipulative skill. Adequacy of hemostasis was assessed as excellent, good, moderate or poor, by the surgeon or interventionalist during Part B of the study.
outcome.time_frame: Day of surgery
outcome.population: 17 participants were included in the Part B ITT population.

group.title: BAY949027 Treatment in Major Surgery, Part B
group.description: Participants who underwent major surgery received study drug during their hospital stay up to 3 weeks post surgery. Participants were treated according to the type of procedure, using tailored doses (a maximum of 60 IU/kg/infusion) expected to maintain acceptable therapeutic level of FVIII activity.

measure.title: Number of Surgeries According to Physician's Assessment of Adequacy of Hemostasis in Major Surgery - Part B

Adequacy of hemostasis was assessed as excellent, good, moderate or poor, by the surgeon or interventionalist during Part B of the study.
measure.population: 17 participants were included in the Part B ITT population.

Total dose per kilogram per Infusion was expressed in international units per kilogram per infusion (IU/kg/infusion).
outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 weeks post-surgery during Part B
outcome.population: Part B ITT population

outcome.title: Maximum Drug Plasma Concentration (Cmax) Following Single and Multiple Doses of BAY94-9027, Chromogenic Assay - Part A
outcome.description: Cmax: Maximum observed drug concentration following an infusion of 60 IU/kg
outcome.time_frame: Weeks 0 and 36: pre-infusion (0 hours), post-infusion 15, 30 minutes, 1, 3, 6, 8, 24, 48, 72, 96 hours
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set (PKS) with participants evaluable for this outcome, PKS included all participants with a valid profile of BAY94-9027 during Part A of the study.

group.title: BAY94-9027 Treatment – Part A, Week 0
group.description: Part A, Week 0 included all PKS participants treated with a single (first) dose of BAY94-9027 as an IV infusion at Week 0.

group.title: BAY94-9027 Treatment – Part A, Week 36
group.description: Part A, Week 36 group included all PKS participants treated with multiple doses (last dose paired) of BAY94-9027 as an IV infusion at Week 36. Paired data were defined as the single dose data for the sub-set of participants who also had multiple dose PK data.

measure.title: Maximum Drug Plasma Concentration (Cmax) Following Single and Multiple Doses of BAY94-9027, Chromogenic Assay - Part A
measure.description: Cmax: Maximum observed drug concentration following an infusion of 60 IU/kg
measure.population: Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set (PKS) with participants evaluable for this outcome, PKS included all participants with a valid profile of BAY94-9027 during Part A of the study.

outcome.title: Terminal Elimination Half Life (t1/2) Following Single and Multiple Doses of BAY94-9027, Chromogenic Assay - Part A

outcome.title: Overall Human Coagulation Factor VIII (FVIII) Recovery Value by Chromogenic Assay - Part A
outcome.description: Recovery was calculated by the following formula: Recovery = (post-infusion FVIII activity - pre-infusion FVIII activity ) * weight / dose (in IU). Recovery is the increase of FVIII activity after the injection normalized by dose: IU/dl per IU/kg = kg/dL
outcome.time_frame: Weeks 0 to 36 during Part A
outcome.population: Part A ITT population

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI) Questionnaire at Week 36 - Part A
outcome.description: The WPAI is a validated instrument to assess the effect of hemophilia on ability to work, attend classes, and perform regular daily activities in participants aged 12 and above. The WPAI also contained classroom impairment questions (CIQ). The questionnaire was self-administered and comprised of nine questions that elicited information on work, classroom, and daily activity impairment during the previous seven days. WPAI outcomes that are overall work and activity impairment, transformed to impairment percentages (range from 0 to 100), with higher numbers indicating greater impairment and less productivity.
outcome.time_frame: Week 0 (baseline) and Week 36 during Part A
outcome.population: Analysis population includes participants evaluable in each category for this outcome.

group.title: BAY94-9027 Prophylaxis Treatment, Every 5 Days, Main Trial
group.description: All participants started BAY94-9027 IV infusion with 2x/week at a dose of 25 IU/kg for 10 weeks. Participants with < 2 spontaneous joint and/or muscle bleeds were randomized 1:1 to either every 5 or every 7 days dosing regimen, participants randomized to the every 5 days treatment arm were to begin treatment with 45 IU/kg every 5 days with the option to increase dose up to 60 IU/kg/infusion.

group.title: BAY949027 Treatment in Major Surgery, Part B

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data were collected after the first dose of study drug and up to 7 days after the last dose over a period of approximately two years.
reported_events.desc: The Adverse Events present the data for the on-going extension of the main trial (Part A and B) as of 09 Jan 2015.

group.title: BAY94-9027 On-demand Treatment, Part A
group.description: Participants received on-demand treatment with BAY94-9027 as an intravenous (IV) infusion at a dose as indicated based upon location and severity of bleeds (a maximum of 60 international units per kilogram [IU/kg]). Participants entering extension either continued their on-demand treatment or switched to one of the prophylaxis regimens.

group.title: BAY94-9027 Prophylaxis Treatment, Part A
group.description: All participants started BAY94-9027 IV infusion, with 2x/week at a dose of 25 IU/kg for 10 weeks. Thereafter, participants with less than 2 spontaneous joint and/or muscle bleeds were randomized 1:1 to either every 5 or every 7 days dosing regimen. High bleeders continued 2x/week infusion (2x/week 'failed'). Participants qualified to be randomized but enrolled after randomized arms were filled, remained on 2x/week treatment (2x/week 'forced' group). Participants entering extension either continued their prophylaxis regimen or switched to one of the other prophylaxis regimens.

group.title: BAY94-9027 Treatment in Major Surgery, Part B
group.description: Participants who underwent major surgery received study drug during their hospital stay up to 3 weeks post-surgery. Participants were treated according to the type of procedure, using tailored doses (a maximum of 60 IU/kg/infusion) expected to maintain acceptable therapeutic level of FVIII activity.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Some registered "Secondary outcome measure" were re-classified as "Other Pre-specified" in line with protocol.
